Authors: Leticia Montoya, Victor M. Bandala, Edith Garay
Title:
Two new species of Lactarius associated with Alnus acuminata
subsp. arguta in Mexico
Keywords:
Ectomycorrhizal fungi, neotropical fungi, Russulales,
Russulaceae, taxonomy
Abstract:
In pure stands of Alnus acuminata subsp. arguta trees from
Sierra Norte de Puebla (Central Mexico), two undescribed ectomycorrhizal
species of Lactarius were discovered. Distinction of the two new species
is based on morphological variation and supported with phylogenetic
analyses of the nuclear ribosomal DNA ITS region and part of the gene
that encodes for the second largest subunit of RNA polymerase II (rpb2).
The phylogenies inferred recovered the two species in different clades
strongly supported by posterior probabilities and bootstrap values. The
new Lactarius species are recognized as part of the assemblage of
ectomycorrhizal fungi associated with Alnus acuminata in Mexico.
Information presented of these taxa includes the morphological variation
achieved along sixteen monitories between 2010 and 2013. Descriptions,
accompanied by photos including SEM photomicrographs of basidiospores
and information on differences between them and other related taxa from
Europe and the United States, including types, are provided.
